c5c58dcd-b331-4423-bde5-1b42e042274f:::||@!@||:::2023-11-01T10:00:00:::||@!@||:::{"id":"c5c58dcd-b331-4423-bde5-1b42e042274f","title":{"en":"Ultra Q (NAKAJO Ken)"},"altTitles":[{"ja":"ウルトラQ"},{"ja-ro":"Urutora Kyū"},{"ja-ro":"Urutora Q"}],"lastChapter":"19","relatedIdds":["0bc617c2-f345-4d8a-8b44-d663311a9e0f","3115a8a6-fbec-4896-af3d-e6495b6bc755","3e0ae1f2-a525-450f-9c07-035f95665e3e","503ce7a9-032a-4178-812d-fd089a755fd0","5cd8edbe-8e41-4af1-b7ae-4a29e85d53c5","68e506bc-c164-4852-9794-d97121786991","c68f5c60-e3fa-45d4-8786-fbd05653f303"],"description":{"en":"(from fukkan.com):\n\n**\"For the next 30 Minutes, your eyes will leave your body and arrive in this strange moment in time...\"**\n--(From Tsuburaya Productions' \"Ultra Q\")\n\nYou can read the masterpiece of that imaginary tokusatsu series in manga form. Don't miss the gripping action with Jun Manjome and Yuriko Edogawa.\n\n≪Description of the work≫.\n\nIn 1966, when the penetration rate of black-and-white televisions exceeded 90%, TBS's \"Ultra Q\" which began airing in January, quickly became a popular program with viewer ratings in the 30% range. Until then, the program offered free weekly encounters with Tsuburaya's monsters, which could only be seen in movie theaters during spring and summer vacations. \n\nIt was no wonder that children waited 1001 days for the Sunday night 7:00 p.m. broadcast. In the publishing world, which is sensitive to the anticipation of the times, Kodansha was the first to recognize the potential of \"Ultra Q\". Ten months before the TV broadcast, the company began serializing the manga in the monthly magazine \"Bokura\". \n\nAfter the initial serialization it was subsequently ceded to a rival, Shueisha's Shonen Book took on the challenge of the first comicalization in its spring vacation extra issue a year later. The first volume, \"I Saw a Bird\" was drawn by Ken Nakajo, who later established his own era with a series of martial arts manga. The magazine received overwhelming support from readers, and Ken Nakajo also published his new drawings in a large-format book called \"komix\" at the time. \n\nMany of the 10 chapters created by Nakajo are long stories with few page restrictions, and they can be said to be a model for TV Manga adaptations.\n\n[Additional Humans reborn as angels and demons get caught up in love stories that span their past and present lives. In this universe that's in the twilight of destruction, one which is filled with monsters, demons, and formidable beings, evil entities are slayed in search of satisfying revenge. He won’t back down in fear, nor will he be bewildered. He doesn’t commit deliberate charity, nor does he seek justice. When I died from all the abuse I endured, I was sent back to a time before all those previous events in my life had happened. After fifteen regressions, I was exhausted.\n\nI prayed, \"I don't want anything to do with this, so please just let me die.\"\n\nAnd at the moment when I thought could finally be able to die, someone said, \"How about being my daughter?\"\n\n…That monstrous grand duke adopted me.\n\n---\n\"I want to quit. I don't want to live being exploited again.\"\n\nDespite having the powers of a saint, she had to live her entire life in captivity—all for the sake of the fake saint who was anointed in secret. Fuji"},"altTitles":[{"ja":"ウルトラQ・SOS富士山"}],"relatedIdds":["c5c58dcd-b331-4423-bde5-1b42e042274f"],"description":{"en":"\"Ultra Q\" is a one-episode sci-fi drama that caused an unprecedented monster boom in Japan in 1966. As the first installment of the \"fantasy special effects series\" of the world-famous hero \"Ultraman\", it recorded a maximum audience rating of 36.4% and an average audience rating of 32.39%. This book \"SOS Mt. Fuji\" is a comic version of the 7th episode (aired on February 13, 1966) of the same title. It is the debut work of Yoshihiro Morifuji, a rare comicalized writer, and the only work published under the name of \"Hiroshi Mori\". For this reason, it has long been regarded as a \"phantom masterpiece by a mysterious writer\". The raw manuscript found at Mr. Morifuji's home has been revived as an electronic comic with beautiful image quality that conveys the pen touch vividly!\n\nSadly Delisted"},"originalLanguage":"ja","publicationDemographic":"shounen","contentRating":"safe","tags":[{"id":"0234a31e-a729-4e28-9d6a-3f87c4966b9e","name":{"en":"Oneshot"}},{"id":"e64f6742-c834-471d-8d72-dd51fc02b835","name":{"en":"Aliens"}},{"id":"ee968100-4191-4968-93d3-f82d72be7e46","name":{"en":"Mystery"}},{"id":"f4122d1c-3b44-44d0-9936-ff7502c39ad3","name":{"en":"Adaptation"}}]}

The bandits recognize his skill and offer to hire him, where he finds a familiar face from the past.  \n  \n3) Confession (Kokuhaku)  \nUnable to forget the random act of kindness by the wealthy, but lonely business man, Matsumi offers to sell his body. Tera-san, the reliable older brother of Tokiwa-sou, appears in \"Manga Michi''. He is a solitary figure who struggled with the current trends in the manga world and ended his career. Both are correct, but there is another answer.\nHe was a person who put his children first and worked hard to write about them.\nIn order to revive that feeling, Manga Shop will regularly publish Tera's works that can no longer be read, starting with this work, \"Sportsman Kintaro.'' Terra is a legendary manga artist who contributed to the development of the manga world with Fujiko Fujio A, Fujiko F. Fujio, Shotaro Ishinomori, Fujio Akatsuka, Shinichi Suzuki, etc., but not only old fans but also Terra from \"Manga Michi\" I would like people who don't know about it to read it without any hesitation. Kintaro and Momotaro, heroes of fairy tales, join the Giants and Nishitetsu, respectively. It received support for its development of a dream showdown with real players such as Oh, Nagashima, and Kaneda using its superhuman powers, and for its healthy touch, which is a little different from the usual sports genre, and won the first Kodansha Children's Manga Award.\n\nThis reissue is the first complete edition (all 9 volumes) that includes all 239 episodes serialized in \"Shonen Sunday\" and 12 one-shot episodes published in a separate volume. c7f31bb1-938c-4821-8c8a-4bdc36f5952e:::||@!@||:::2023-11-01T10:00:00:::||@!@||:::{"id":"c7f31bb1-938c-4821-8c8a-4bdc36f5952e","title":{"en":"Akuma-kun (Zen)"},"altTitles":[{"ja":"悪魔くん(全)"}],"lastChapter":"6","description":{"en":"It is said that once every 10,000 years, a child capable of reading and understanding the ancient Jewish scriptures for Demon resurrection, will be born into the world. The last person to come close to achieving such a feat was the great Professor Faust who, through sheer will-power alone has managed to live for 300 years in anticipation of the advent of the next \"chosen one\" so that he can impart his knowledge directly before he can die.\n\nThat child is Shingo Yamada, A.K.A: Akuma-kun. Shingo is a boy genius living in Japan who, with the help of his close friends, is attempting to solve the riddle of Demon resurrection so that he can use the tremendous power of the Demons to unite the world as one nation where everyone can live as equals and in total harmony with each other.\n\nShingo's efforts are effectively fruitless until he encounters Professor Faust. Upon receiving Faust's assistance, he is able to resurrect a demon called Mephisto and is able to control him by using the magical Solomon flute that was entrusted to him by Faust before he died.\nBefore long however, Shingo finds himself a target for powerful wizards that are hell-bent on procuring the powerful Solomon's flute for their own evil intents. Thus begins the many trials of Akuma-kun and Mephisto as they work together to protect the world from some of the most frightening demons the world has ever seen!\n\nWritten 2 years after the end of the Original Akuma-kun rental comic book, Shigeru Mizuki revisits his characters and changes the entire theme of the story. In this version, Akuma-kun's name has been changed from Ichiro Matsushita to Shingo Yamada in order to tie-in with the black and white television drama that aired on Japanese T.V at the same time as publication. In this version, Akuma-kun is a kindhearted boy that seeks to defeat evil demons and Yokai with the help of his reluctant friend, Mephisto, for the better good of society."},"links":{"al":"56386","amz":"https://www.amazon.co.jp/%E6%82%AA%E9%AD%94%E3%81%8F%E3%82%93-%E3%81%A1%E3%81%8F%E3%81%BE%E6%96%87%E5%BA%AB-%E6%B0%B4%E6%9C%A8-%E3%81%97%E3%81%92%E3%82%8B/dp/4480025413"},"originalLanguage":"ja","publicationDemographic":"seinen","contentRating":"safe","tags":[{"id":"36fd93ea-e8b8-445e-b836-358f02b3d33d","name":{"en":"Monsters"}},{"id":"391b0423-d847-456f-aff0-8b0cfc03066b","name":{"en":"Action"}},{"id":"39730448-9a5f-48a2-85b0-a70db87b1233","name":{"en":"Demons"}},{"id":"87cc87cd-a395-47af-b27a-93258283bbc6","name":{"en":"Adventure"}},{"id":"eabc5b4c-6aff-42f3-b657-3e90cbd00b75","name":{"en":"Supernatural"}}]}

The country is in great chaos due to the infamous Jin Kang Rebellion. Fearing the possible destruction that is sure to ensue, Concubine Liu tearfully entrusts the care of her baby daughter, Princess Yi Fu, to a common citizen named Tang Hui. Tang Hui immediately escapes with the princess to the south. And so, Princess Yi Fu's whereabouts become a mystery.  \nNow, ten years later, the Tang have returned to power and the great family wishes for all exiled family members to return. But Zi Li is happy with her life. She knows that returning means giving up her love; for a peasant could never court a princess. And courtship between a princess and a palace warrior is equally frowned upon.
